conclusion: Understand the graph with Car A's curve having two arcs and Car B's straight line; y-axis is velocity, x-axis is time.
Car A's graph consists of two arcs, indicating a change in velocity.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity.
Car A's acceleration can be determined by the slope of the tangent line to the curve.
First arc (0 to 2 seconds) starts with decreasing velocity, indicating negative acceleration.
Tangent lines on the first arc have negative slopes.
Second arc (2 to 4 seconds) shows increasing velocity, indicating positive acceleration.
Tangent lines on the second arc have positive slopes.
Compare tangents: first arc has negative slopes, second arc has positive slopes.
Direction of Car A's acceleration changed from negative to positive.
Final answer: Yes, the direction of Car A's acceleration changed.
